response.message:
I think that cat was inspired by Homer Simpson:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jXesMkAYh44

> The site newsletters are meant for all of those sites that you find interesting but aren’t quite addicted to enough to visit every day

Yup I've got about 10 of those that I don't ever visit (but I mean to) unless I have a question to ask. Great idea.

When I visit the stackexchange site it says you are currently subscribed to "1 newsletter".  If someone has not confirmed the subscription via e-mail should this really be one?  I would say you should only display this once a confirmation is made via the e-mail link.  If the free press called me and asked if I wanted the paper for a week, I'm not really subscribed to it unless I confirm and really want it.  (Bug perhaps?)
I find Taco's misspelling confusing, and I wish to know if it's part of the joke or not. ;)
It's not easy to type with paws

I find Taco’s misspelling confusing, and I wish to know if it’s part of the joke or not. ;)
@gnovice: it's not deliberate, or Taco's fault, it's just a UI error...

Is there a way to just view the newsletter via the web site rather than getting an email?  I know there are previews for the newsletters but I'd like an RSS feed that I can put in my Google Reader and view at my convenience rather than getting an email every week.  I realize there is the weekly hot questions tab, but it sounds like the newsletter is a bit more than that...
is it a cat?[confused:?]it's more a dog or wolf like.:)
